page.title: 06BUILDINGS
page.content: At Hollow Meadows,there was, until circa 1974,a hospital for Mentally ill patients,but it has recently been resold and is being rebuilt to serve as a hotel. The only buildings for religious observance in the area are two Methodist chapels,one in Dungworth,the other at Moscar at the S.W.edge of the area. An interesting historical feature is the presence of a Jew's burial ground at Crawshaw Head behind a building which was a lodge for estate workers. The burial ground is shown on Ordinance Survey maps of circa 1840, but is now derelict,the remains being recently reburied elsewhere as a result of desecration in 1982.
